pullRequest.title: Display parent channel details
pullRequest.bodyText:
What is it?

 Bug fix (user facing)
 Feature (user facing)
 Code base improvement (dev facing)
 Meta improvement to the project (dev facing)

Description of the changes in your PR

Add sub-channel details to channel fragment & video detail fragment
Relies on the following changes
TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor#313
Testing apk

NewPipe_displayparentchanneldetails-debug.zip
Agreement

 I carefully read the contribution guidelines and agree to them.

nodes.bodyText: This should be used only for testing locally. When you publish the PR, you should put in app/build.gradle implementation 'com.github.royosef:NewPipeExtractor:48b397567813a8b78a21d47e830e879b49e7036c' //your last newpipe extractor commit.
Why does this have an extra space before it?
Why does this have an extra space before it?

beforeCommit.message:
Fix PR review

Make all of the uploader section on stream page navigate to the channel page
Extract hard coded strings
Remove redundant spaces
Fix open streams from a channel
Rename "ParentChannel" to "SubChannel"
Config royosef:NewPipeExtractor in app/build.gradle

commit.message: Add sub-channel details to video detail fragment
Add sub-channel details to channel fragment

Fix PR review

Make all of the uploader section on stream page navigate to the channel page
Extract hard coded strings
Remove redundant spaces
Fix open streams from a channel
Rename "ParentChannel" to "SubChannel"
Config royosef:NewPipeExtractor in app/build.gradle
Navigate to parent(uploader) channel from the uploader section on long click

beforeCommit.message: Navigate to parent(uploader) channel from the uploader section on long click

afterCommit.message: Don't show sub-channel thumbnail by default

nodes.bodyText: Why is this checking whether a subchannel exists, but then the parent uploader url is used?

Shouldn't you also hide subChannelThumb? just to be sure that it is gone, because I think it could happen (i.e. when restoring instance) that handleResult is called twice and with different results, thus possibly resulting in wrongly showing the thumbnail left behind from the previous call. Not sure though if this is really an issue, but this is already the implemented behaviour with uploaderThumb

commit.message: Don't show sub-channel thumbnail by default

nodes.bodyText: why is this a warning? Apart from that, this info should only be put in the log in debug apks
